rules.prover9_expression: (temperature_optimal(fridge_sensor, cooling_zone) | (-(food_item_fresh(produce_sensor, vegetables) -> meal_prepared_successfully(system, dinner)) -> schedule_grocery_delivery(smart_fridge, service)))
rules.natural: Either the fridge sensor indicates that the cooling zone temperature is optimal, or if it is not the case that the produce sensor indicates that the vegetables are fresh food items implies the system has prepared the dinner successfully, then the smart fridge schedules the grocery delivery service.
Provided that the smart outlet has sufficient power for the appliance, the system prepares the dinner successfully.
The smart outlet has sufficient power for the appliance or the power system has an active battery backup for the kitchen.

The smart fridge has a recipe for the dinner plan or it has a backup recipe for the dinner plan.

Under the condition that the timer indicates that cooking is complete for the meal, the system prepares the dinner successfully.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(manual_override_active(user, cooking_program) | (ingredients_substitutable(chef_mode, unavailable_items) -> (has_recipe(smart_fridge, dinner_plan) -> (has_sufficient(ingredient_stock, meal_prep) | meal_prepared_successfully(system, dinner))))) -> automatic_mode_active(system, cooking_program))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that either the user has manual override active for the cooking program or if the chef mode has ingredients that are substitutable for unavailable items, then under the condition that the smart fridge has a recipe for the dinner plan, either the ingredient stock has sufficient quantity for meal preparation or the system has prepared the dinner successfully, then the system has automatic mode active for the cooking program.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(energy_efficient_mode_active(smart_grid, appliances) -> (-(food_item_fresh(produce_sensor, vegetables) -> cooking_complete(timer, meal)) -> -cooking_extended(timer, meal))) -> power_surge_detected(smart_grid, circuit))
rules.natural: If it is not the case that if the smart grid has energy-efficient mode active for the appliances, then provided that it is not the case that the produce sensor indicates that the vegetables are fresh food items implies the timer indicates that cooking is complete for the meal, the timer does not indicate that cooking is extended for the meal, then the smart grid has detected a power surge on the circuit.
